name: TheAtlantic
text: “I didn’t have any illusions that the people in Cuba had the same freedoms I did,” @KarenBassTweets told @IsaacDovere. “I came home and was protesting everything; I knew that the Cuban people didn’t have the ability to do that.” https://t.co/r0LOQRW1He

name: TheAtlantic
text: Small businesses have played a big role in revitalizing towns across America—but the pandemic is straining them. @JamesFallows on two local brewing companies and how they're surviving: https://t.co/ZBlu0i9vGJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I’ve been hauling balloons into my apartment recently, great gaggles of them, in the interest of general mood elevation. There have been occasions, too, moments to mark: birthdays, graduations, whatever. They’re over. But the balloons remain...." https://t.co/Ax69Ln2UrO

name: TheAtlantic
text: Absent the usual summer blockbusters, the landscape of American entertainment is barren enough for C- shows and movies to rack up the viewership of B+ productions, Hannah Giorgis writes. https://t.co/7W4bgl9hO8

text: "We have fully embraced our collective dedication to the boundary. As I drive around, I am amused by the painted bear statues that now all exhibit handmade cloth masks," Annette Saunooke Clapsaddle writes: https://t.co/4q2JFWpT4v

text: "For 15 years we've just been dead in the water." Cosmologists who question the existence of dark matter have spent decades looking for a plausible alternative. Now, @walkingthedot reports, they may have found one: https://t.co/QDOqrRL4zI

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos: From the Skylands, to the Palisades, to the farms and cranberry bogs, and down the Jersey Shore to Cape May, here are a few glimpses of the landscape of New Jersey and some of the wildlife and people calling it home. https://t.co/HY1oLuv8Kx
